etymologies: early 19th century. From German Margarit from Hellenistic Greek μάργαρον pearl + German -it

definitions: A calcium aluminium silicate of the mica group, CaAl₄ Si₂ O₁₀ (OH)₂, usually occurring as minute scales with a pearly lustre. Formerly also called pearl mica.
A line of globulites resembling a string of pearls, commonly occurring in glassy igneous rocks.
